computer.builtInGames: 2 Microsoft BASIC interpreters - MO5 compatible and BASIC 128
computer.description:
The Thomson MO 6 was the successor of the Thomson MO 5. This machine was widely used in French schools. It was compatible with the MO 5 and the other members of its family (TO 7, TO 8, TO 9 and TO 9 plus).
It has two versions of BASIC on ROM, one to be compatible with MO5 and BASIC 128 (both made by Microsoft). Almost all memory (101 KB) was accessible with BASIC thanks to a transparent 16 KB bank switching mechanism. An optional 3.5" floppy disk drive (640 KB) was available.
It had a short life because soon after it was launched, the TO 8 came and challenged to it.
The MO5 was also sold in Italy by Olivetti under the name Prodest PC-128

emulator.description: Easy to use emulator, to run MO5 games without knowing MO5 commands
emulator.name: DCMO5 Gamer Edition

emulator.description: Thomson MO5NR, Thomson MO6 and Olivetti Prodest PC128 emulator for PC
emulator.name: DCMO6

emulator.description: Universal 8-bit Thomson emulator for Windows. Emulates Thomson MO5, MO5E, MO5NR, MO6, T9000, TO7/70, TO8, TO8D, TO9, TO9+ and Olivetti Prodest PC128 !
emulator.name: DCMOTO

emulator.description: Thomson T9000, TO7/70, TO8, TO8D emulator for Windows
emulator.name: DCTO7 and DCTO8

emulator.description: No, you are not dreaming. This is a TO-7/70 emulator for the Dreamcast game system !
emulator.name: TODC

computer.graphics: 8 modes, from 160 x 200 to 640 x 200 dots

computer.keyboard: Full stroke 69 key with 5 function keys and arrow keys

computer.name: MO 6
computer.ports: Light Pen, Joystick, Mouse, Centronics, Cartridge, External Audio, Bus, RGB

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;MAINBOARD</strong></font><br><blockquote><font color = "red">(1)</font> Two ROM chips holding two versions of Microsoft BASIC<br> <font color = "red">(2)</font> ROM cartridges connector<br> <font color = "red">(3)</font> TV aerial modulator<br> <font color = "red">(4)</font> I/O are managed by Two 6821P PIA chips <br> <font color = "red">(5)</font> EF-9369P graphics video chip<br> <font color = "red">(6)</font> Keyboard connectors<br> <font color = "red">(7)</font> Four 41464 (64 cells x 4 bits) chips hold 128 Kb of RAM<br> <font color = "red">(8)</font> Custom gate array chip made by Texas Instruments<br> <font color = "red">(9)</font> Motorola 6809EP processor<br> <font color = "red">(10)</font> Power supply unit<br><
